properties.areaDesc: Chesapeake Bay from Little Creek VA to Cape Henry VA including the Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel; Coastal Waters from Cape Charles Light to Virginia-North Carolina border out to 20 nm; James River from Jamestown to the James River Bridge; Coastal waters from Parramore Island to Cape Charles Light VA out 20 nm; Chesapeake Bay from New Point Comfort to Little Creek VA; James River from James River Bridge to Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued January 25 at 4:33AM EST by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
The areas affected include...
Chesapeake Bay from New Point Comfort to Little Creek VA...
Entrance to the Chesapeake Bay including the Chesapeake Bay Bridge
Tunnel...
James River from Jamestown to the Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel...

Coastal Waters from Parramore Island to the VA/NC Border out 20
NM...

At 430 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated showers, capable of producing
winds to around 30 knots. These showers were located along a line
extending from near James River Bridge to 24 nm southwest of Monitor
Merrimack Bridge Tunnel to 20 nm northwest of Edenton, moving east
to northeast at 25 knots.

showers will be near...
James River Bridge around 445 AM EST.
Dominion Pier and Monitor Merrimack Bridge Tunnel around 450 AM
EST.
Hampton Flats, Hampton River Inlet and Sewells Point around 500 AM
EST.
Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel and Willoughby Bay around 505 AM EST.
Thimble Shoals and Little Creek around 515 AM EST.
Bluefish Rock around 520 AM EST.
Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel, 1st Island Bay Bridge and Lynnhaven
around 525 AM EST.
4th Island Bay Bridge and Cape Henry around 535 AM EST.
properties.instruction:
Mariners can expect gusty winds to around 30 knots...locally higher
waves...and heavy downpours. Boaters should exercise caution or seek
safe harbor immediately until these storms pass.

This showers will likely produce winds to around 30 knots...and could
pose a serious hazard for boaters. A special marine warning may
eventually be required when these storms reach the Chesapeake Bay.
Boaters should consider heading for shore before these storms arrive.

NWSheadline: SHOWERS WITH GUSTY WINDS APPROACHING THE WATERS
